intro: Fagara bijuga, commonly known as the black elderberry, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Fagara bijuga thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value and medicinal properties make it a notable species in its native habitat.
